metadata.title: CVE-2020-11089 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
In FreeRDP before 2.1.0, there is an out-of-bound read in irp functions (parallel_process_irp_create, serial_process_irp_create, drive_process_irp_write, printer_process_irp_write, rdpei_recv_pdu, serial_process_irp_write). This has been fixed in 2.1.0.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-11089` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-1
freerdp2-wayland - 2.1.1+dfsg1-1
freerdp2-x11 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-1
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-1
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-1
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-1
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-1
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-1
libuwac0-0 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-1
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-1
libwinpr2-2 - 2.1.1+dfsg1-1
winpr-utils - 2.1.1+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

notes.note: mdeslaur> The freerdp package in Ubuntu 16.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.04 LTS does not build a server library. This is simply a client denial of service that has a negligible security impact.

criterions.comment: freerdp2 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.1+dfsg1-1').
